entry.title: Sociophysics Simulations
entry.summary: Reviews models of Bonabeau et al and Sznajd et al

entry.title: Heat,temperature and relativity
entry.summary: Relativistic thermodynamics as result of some recent computer simulations is derived.

entry.title: Is microcanonical ensemble stable?
entry.summary: No, in a rigorous sense specified below.

entry.title: Towards a new scenario for the XY Kosterlitz-Thouless transition
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Transverse dynamics of spin-1/2 XX chain with correlated Lorentzian disorder
entry.summary: Using numerical approach developed recently we obtained the transverse dynamic structure factor for the spin-1/2 transverse XX chain with correlated Lorentzian disorder.

entry.title: Quantizing the Lotka-Volterra equations: Effects of discretization
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors.

entry.title: On Equivalence of Thermostatistical Formalisms
entry.summary: We make some simple observations on basic issues pertaining to thermostatistical formalisms.

entry.title: Melting in two dimensions with particle conservation
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Quantum Phase Transition of Hole-Doped Antiferromagnets
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Charged Brownian Particle in a Magnetic Field
entry.summary: We derive explicit forms of Markovian transition probability densities for the velocity space and phase-space Brownian motion of a charged particle in a constant magnetic field.

entry.title: Sign-time distribution for a random walker with a drifting boundary
entry.summary: We present a derivation of the exact sign-time distribution for a random walker in the presence of a boundary moving with constant velocity.

entry.title: How Traders enter the Market through the Book
entry.summary: Simulation of the trading activity based on the implementation of the book.

entry.title: Comment on "Universal Fluctuations in Correlated Systems"
entry.summary: This is a Comment on "Universal Fluctuations in Correlated Systems".
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Phys. Rev. Lett

entry.title: Computational Complexity in Physics
entry.summary: This is a brief review paper summarizing talks at the NATO school on Complexity and Large Deviations in Geilo, Norway, 2001.

entry.title: Social Percolation and the Influence of Mass Media
entry.summary: Mass media shift the percolative phase transition observed in the marketing model of Solomon and Weisbuch.

entry.title: Anomalous heat conduction in one dimensional momentum-conserving systems
entry.summary: We show that for one dimensional systems with momentum conservation, the thermal conductivity $\kappa$ generically diverges with system size as $L^{1/3}.$

entry.title: Complex Systems: a Physicist's Viewpoint
entry.summary: I present my viewpoint on complexity, stressing general arguments and using a rather simple language.

entry.title: Time Interval Distribution of Earthquakes
entry.summary: The statistical properties of time intervals between significant earthquakes are found to be described by the Zipf-Mandelbrot-Tsallis-type distribution.

entry.title: On the relativistic generalization of Maxwell's velocity distribution
entry.summary: Some problems relevant to the relativistic generalization of Maxwell's velocity distribution are discussed.

entry.title: Nonequilibrium thermodynamics ?
entry.summary: Twentyseven comments (.) on the Second Law and nonequilibrium systems

entry.title: Reply to a Comment
entry.summary: Reply to the Comment by F. Corberi, E. Lipiello and M. Zannetti (cond-mat/0211609).

entry.title: Comment on "Microcanonical Mean Field Thermodynamics of Self-Gravitating and Rotating systems"
entry.summary: A comment on cond-mat/0210707, cond-mat/0208230, cond-mat/0207153, and cond-mat/0202140.

entry.title: When nonlinear Fokker-Planck equations yield power-law distributions?
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

author.name: Sumiyoshi Abe
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Physics, University of Tsukuba, Ibaraki

entry.title: The Diffusion Equation on a Hypersphere
entry.summary: We study the diffusion equation on the surface of a 4D sphere and obtain a Kubo formula for the diffusion coefficient.

entry.title: Qualms regarding "Superstatistics" by C. Beck and E. G. D. Cohen, Physica A 321 (2003) (cond-mat/0205097)
entry.summary: There is neither motivation nor need to introduce 'superstatistics.'

entry.title: Qualms concerning Tsallis' use of the maximum entropy formalism
entry.summary: Tsallis' 'statistical thermodynamic' formulation of the nonadditive entropy of degree-\alpha is neither correct nor self-consistent.

entry.title: "Qualms" from Lavenda, cond-mat/0311270
entry.summary: The smoke (German: Qualm) produced by Lavenda obscures the simple and fundamental physics of non-extensive systems as proposed in [1].

entry.title: Complex systems under stochastic dynamics
entry.summary: A stochastic dynamics framework for the study of complex systems is presented.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Atti della Fondazione Giorgio Ronchi, volume LVIII, pages 805-818 (2003)

entry.title: Fluctuation theorem revisited
entry.summary: Recently the ``Fluctuation theorem'' has been criticized and incorrect incorrect contents have been atributed to it. Here I reestablish and comment the original statements.

entry.title: Entropy scaling laws for diffusion
entry.summary: Comment to the letter of Samanta et al., Phys. Rev. Lett. 92, 145901 (2004).

entry.title: About the depletion profile in nucleation kinetics
entry.summary: The profile of vapor around the droplet growing in the diffusion regime with known moving boundary have been calculated and expressed in terms of special functions.

entry.title: On the Surface Tensions of Binary Mixtures
entry.summary: For binary mixtures with fixed concentrations of the species, various relationships between the surface tensions and the concentrations are briefly reviewed.

entry.title: Equilibrium Statistical Mechanics
entry.summary: An introductory review of Classical Statistical Mechanics
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, ed. J.P. Francoise, G.L. Naber, Tsou Sheung Tsun, Vol. 1, 51--87, 2006, Elsevier, ISBN:978-0-12-512660-1

entry.title: On a geometric mean and power-law statistical distributions
entry.summary: For a large class of statistical systems a geometric mean value of the observables is constrained. These observables are characterized by a power-law statistical distribution.

entry.title: Nonequilibrium Phase Transitions in Model Ferromagnets: A Review
entry.summary: The nonequilibrium dynamic phase transitions in ferromagnetic models (Ising, XY and Heisenberg) are reviewed on the basis of very recent work in this field.
entry.arxiv:comment: Int. J. Mod. Phys. C (2005) (in press)

entry.title: Highly optimized fourth-order short-time approximation for path integrals
entry.summary: This paper is withdrawn due to copyright restrictions. The final version will become available at this url: http://pubs.acs.org/journals/jpcbfh/

entry.title: Reply to comments by D.H.E. Gross
entry.summary: This is a brief response to a recent posting by Gross.

entry.title: Reply to Jarzynski's comment cond-mat/0509344
entry.summary: A short reply to Jarzynski's comment cond-mat/0509344 on my paper ``Flaw of Jarzynski's equality when applied to systems with several degrees of freedom'' (cond--mat/0508721) is presented.

entry.title: Stationary nonequilibrium statistical mechanics
entry.summary: A brief review on the dynamical systems approach to nonequilibrium statistical mechanics and chaotic dynamics
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, ed. J.P. Francoise, G.L. Naber, Tsou Sheung Tsun, 3, 530--539, 2006, Elsevier

entry.title: Comment on ``Temporal scaling at Feigenbaum point and nonextensive thermodynamics" by P. Grassberger
entry.summary: Critiques presented by P. Grassberger in Phys. Rev. Lett. 95, 140601 (2005) are addressed.

entry.title: Comment on "Model for Heat Conduction in Nanofluids"
entry.summary: A Comment on the Letter by D. Hemanth Kumar et al., Phys. Rev. Lett. 93, 144301 (2004)

entry.title: Comments on ``Observation of Strong Quantum Depletion in a Gaseous Bose-Einstein Condensate" [cond-mat/0601184]
entry.summary: We suggested a method to estimate the quantum depletion of interacting Bose particles confined by a three dimensional harmonic trap.

entry.title: Cluster Probability in Bootstrap Percolation
entry.summary: We develop a recursive formula for the probability of a k-cluster in bootstrap percolation.

entry.title: Comment on "Failure of the Jarzynski identity for a simple quantum system"
entry.summary: The distribution of work done on a quantum system by instantaneously changing the Hamiltonian is shown to satisfy the Jarzynski identity.

entry.title: Introduction to Phase Transitions in Random Optimization Problems
entry.summary: Notes of the lectures delivered in Les Houches during the Summer School on Complex Systems (July 2006).
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Complex Systems, Les Houches Summer School 2006 (2008) 1

entry.title: Widom-Rowlinson model (continuum and lattice)
entry.summary: This is a short review about liquid-vapor and crystalline phase transitions in continuum and lattice Widom-Rowlinson models.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, to appear in "Selecta" within the project "Modern Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics" (Springer)

entry.title: Anyons and lowest Landau level Anyons
entry.summary: A review on the Anyon model and the lowest Landau level Anyon model is presented.

entry.title: Different scenarios of the late stages of condensation
entry.summary: The late stages of the nucleation have been described analytically. The approximate solution of the Zel'dowich-Folmer-Frenkel equation has been constructed.

entry.title: Perturbative theory approaches to the metastable phase decay
entry.summary: The perturbative theory of the nucleation kinetics is analyzed. A new improvement is suggested and compared with numerical calculations.

entry.title: 500-th solution of 2D Ising model
entry.summary: One more solution of 2D Ising model is found

entry.title: Dilute Hard "Sphere" Bose Gas in Dimensions 2, 4 and 5
entry.summary: The ground state energy for a dilute hard "sphere" Bose gas in various dimensions is studied theoretically.

entry.title: Comments on "Thermally induced rotons in two-dimensional dilute Bose gases" [arXiv:cond-mat/0503523]
entry.summary: A mistake of the effective interaction between D-dimensional Bose atoms [arXiv:cond-mat/0503523] that was published by Physical Review B in 2006 is corrected.

entry.title: S-ordered phase-space path integrals and time-s-ordering of Heisenberg operators (reseach notes)
entry.summary: Formal structure of phase-space path integrals based on different types of operator orderings is analysed.

entry.title: Exploring the Rheology of Soft Glassy Matter
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to some problems. Please contact me.

entry.title: The volume enclosed by an n-dimensional Lam curve
entry.summary: We compute the volume of the body enclosed by the $n$-dimensional Lam\'e curve defined by $\sum_{i=1}^nx_i^b= E$.

entry.title: Nonequilibrium evolution thermodynamics
entry.summary: A new approach - nonequilibrium evolution thermodynamics, is compared with classical variant of Landau approach

entry.title: Cycle decomposition of full counting statistics
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to an error in the derivation.

entry.title: A note on the Lee-Yang circle theorem
entry.summary: A simple proof of the celebrated theorem of Lee and Yang is attempted in this short note.

entry.title: Macroscopic fluctuation theory of local collisional dynamics
entry.summary: We explain why the macroscopic fluctuations of deterministic local collision dynamics should be characterized by a non strictly convex functional.

entry.title: Statistical mechanics of interfaces
entry.summary: Mathematical aspects of the theory of interfaces in statistical mechanics are discussed.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, Elsevier, Oxford, 2006, vol. 5, pp. 55-63

entry.title: On the convergence of cluster expansions
entry.summary: Two theorems on the theory of cluster expansions for an abstract polymer system are reported.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, Mathematisches Forschungsinstitut Conference, Oberwolfach, Germany, 2001

entry.title: Equivalence classes for large deviations
entry.summary: We show the existence of equivalence classes for large deviations. Stochastic dynamics within an equivalence class share the same large deviation properties.

entry.title: Comment: Characterizing dynamic length scales in glass forming liquids
entry.summary: Comment on Nature Physics 8, 164 (2012) by Kob, Roldan-Vargas and Berthier

entry.title: Melting of Wigner-like Lattice of Parallel Polarized Dipoles
entry.summary: We show that a triangular lattice consisting of dipolar molecules pointing orthogonal to the plane undergoes a first-order defect melting transition.

entry.title: Comment on "Force-field functor theory" [arXiv:1306.4332]
entry.summary: This comment regards a recently published preprint by R.Babbush, J.A.Parkhill, and A.Aspuru-Guzik, arXiv:1306.4332.

entry.title: Quantum Statistical Mechanics. III. Equilibrium Probability
entry.summary: Given are a first principles derivation and formulation of the probabilistic concepts that underly equilibrium quantum statistical mechanics. The transition to non-equilibrium probability is traversed briefly.

entry.title: Simplified Derivation of the Non-Equilibrium Probability Distribution
entry.summary: A simple and transparent derivation of the formally exact probability distribution for classical non-equilibrium systems is given. The corresponding stochastic, dissipative equations of motion are also derived.

entry.title: Reply to Schneider et al. [arXiv:1407.4127v1]
entry.summary: We respond to invalid criticism in the recent Comment by Schneider et al. [arXiv:1407.4127v1]

entry.title: Legendre transforms of the fundamental thermodynamic relation and statistical ensembles
entry.summary: We show how the Legendre transforms of the fundamental thermodynamic relation can be used to introduce different statistical ensembles.

entry.title: Accelerated rare event sampling
entry.summary: A sampling procedure for the transition matrix Monte Carlo method is introduced that generates the density of states function over a wide parameter range with minimal coding effort.

entry.title: Comptes Rendus Physique Issue on Coarsening Dynamics
entry.summary: This is the list of original contributions to the Comptes Rendus Physique Issue on Coarsening Dynamics (Vol. 16, Issue 3, 2015).

entry.title: Comments on "Identifying Functional Thermodynamics in Autonomous Maxwellian Ratchets" (arXiv:1507.01537v2)
entry.summary: We make a few comments on some misleading statements in the above paper.

entry.title: Povrchov fzov pechody a kritick jevy
entry.summary: Brief introduction to the theory of surface phase transitions at planar interfaces, such as wetting phenomena (in Czech).

entry.title: Kernel/Metric Correspondence of Dissipative Systems in Information Theory
entry.summary: We study the kernel/metric correspondence pointed out in our previous work in a dissipative system which is accompanying fractional Brownian motion. We also give some comments on information causality.

entry.title: On the Kinetic Properties of Solitons in Nonlinear Schrdinger Equation
entry.summary: The Boltzmann type kinetic equation for solitons in Nonlinear Schr\"{o}dinger equation has been constructed on the base of analysis of two soliton collision. Possible applications for Langmuir solitons in plasma and solitons in optic fiber are discussed.

entry.title: Critical Exponents of the Four-State Potts Model
Dynamic Scaling in Epitaxial Growth
entry.summary: A review is provided of our current theoretical understanding of dynamic scaling in nonequilibrium interface growth as, for example, in MBE growth under ultrahigh vacuum deposition conditions.

entry.title: Beyond the Sherrington-Kirkpatrick Model
entry.summary: The state of art in spin glass field theory is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: contribution to the volume "Spin Glasses and Random Fields", ed. P. Young, World Scientific. Latex file and lprocl.sty (style-file). 41 pages, no figures

entry.title: Canonically invariant formulation of Langevin and Fokker-Planck Equations
entry.summary: We present a canonically invariant form for the generalized Langevin and Fokker-Planck equations. We discuss the role of constants of motion, and the construction of conservative stochastic processes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, RevTeX. Submitted to J. Phys. A

entry.title: Note on "From Quantum Dynamics to the Canonical Distribution: A Rigorous Derivation in Special Models"
entry.summary: This is a note associated with my paper "From Quantum Dynamics to the Canonical Distribution: A Rigorous Derivation in Special Models" (cond-mat/9707253). Here I describe all the technical details which are not discussed in the main paper.

entry.title: Non-periodic long-range order for fast decaying interactions at positive temperatures
entry.summary: We present the first example of an exponentially decaying interaction which gives rise to non-periodic long-range order at positive temperatures.

entry.title: Statistical field theory of hierarchical avalanche ensemble
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: The geometrically broken object
entry.summary: We introduce an analytically solvable model for a fragmented object that, despite of a low degree of randomness and of the extreme simplicity of the breaking process, displays non self-averaging effects in its thermodynamic limit.

author.name: Andrea De Martino
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dip. Fisica, Univ. "La Sapienza", Rome, Italy

entry.title: Density of State in a Complex Random Matrix Theory with External Source
entry.summary: The density of state for a complex $N\times N$ random matrix coupled to an external deterministic source is considered for a finite N, and a compact expression in an integral representation is obtained.

entry.title: Comment on the "Density profiles in the theory of condensation" (Physica A, 226 (1996) 117-136). Stationary profiles of the condensation
entry.summary: Some simplifications of the theory of the density profiles of condensation are discussed. The role of the additive effects is outlined.

entry.title: Master equations for extremal models
entry.summary: A general method to derive the master equations for extremal models is established. These systems are shown to develop a peculiar kind of correlations between elements related to the characterization of extremal dynamics as an information process.

entry.title: Critical properties of Toom cellular automata
entry.summary: This paper is the continuation of our earlier considerations on cellular automata with Toom local rule (TCA) as the alternative to kinetic Ising systems. The arguments for TCA stationary states not being the equilibrium states are found in simulations.

entry.title: Reply to "Comment on `Non-universal exponents in interface growth'"
entry.summary: We reply to the recent comment cond-mat/9809184 on our original paper `Non-universal exponents in interface growth', Phys. Rev. Lett, 79, 2261 (1997).

entry.title: Reply to "Comment on `Roughening Transition of Interfaces in Disordered Systems'"
entry.summary: We reply to the recent comment cond-mat/9810097 on our original Letter `Roughening Transition of Interfaces in Disordered Systems', Phys. Rev. Lett. 81, 1469 (1998).

entry.title: Spontaneous Symmetry Breaking in the Quantum Sine-Gordon Model
entry.summary: The spontaneous symmetry breaking in the quantum sine-Gordon model is studied by a density matrix renormalization group. A phase diagram in the coupling constant - system size plane is obtained.
entry.arxiv:comment: Accepted for publication in J. Korea Phys. Soc

entry.title: How to account for virtual arbitrage in the standard derivative pricing
entry.summary: In this short note we show how virtual arbitrage opportunities can be modelled and included in the standard derivative pricing without changing the general framework.

entry.title: Reply to comment on ``Dynamic scaling in the spatial distribution of persistent sites''
entry.summary: We reply to the comment cond-mat/9902073 by Ben-Naim and Krapivsky on our paper cond-mat/9901130. We show that their arguments are incorrect, and present more numerical results to back our earlier conclusions.

author.name: G. Manoj
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Mathematical Sciences, Chennai, India

author.name: P. Ray
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Mathematical Sciences, Chennai, India

entry.title: Critical Crashes?
entry.summary: In this short note we discuss recent attempts to describe pre-crash market dynamics with analogies from theory of critical phenomena.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, Latex, to appear in Int.J.Mod.Phys.C

entry.title: On a trivial aspect of canonical specific heat scaling
entry.summary: We show that the canonical finite size scaling of the specific heat emerges naturally - and in some sense trivially - from the assumption that the microcanonical specific entropy exhibits no substantial system size dependence.

entry.title: Fractional-differential equations of motion
entry.summary: An elementary system leading to the notions of fractional integrals and derivatives is considered. Various physical situations whose description is associated with fractional differential equations of motion are discussed.

entry.title: Persistence in Nonequilibrium Systems
entry.summary: This is a brief review of recent theoretical efforts to understand persistence in nonequilibrium systems. Some of the recent experimental results are also briefly mentioned. I also discuss recent generalizations of persistence in various directions and conclude with a summary of open questions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Brief review on persistence written for Current Science

entry.title: Exact Exponents of Supersonic Turbulence in Arbitrary Dimensions
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: Bi-Composability and Generalized Entropy Composition with Different q Indices
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author and the content is merged into a new paper: H-Theorem and Generalized Entropy Composition with Different q Indices: cond-mat/9912454.

entry.title: Dynamics of a self-repelling random walker
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: Reply on `Comment on ``Comment on `Macroscopic Equation for the Roughness of Growing Interfaces in Quenched Disorder'' '
entry.summary: Reply to ``Comment on [Phys. Rev. Lett. 81, 630 (1998)]''

entry.title: Multicomponent nonisothermal nucleation. 3. Numerical results
entry.summary: The final (third) part of the theory gives the results of numerical calculations according to the formulas derived in the previous two parts. Also the comparison with the already published theories is given. Some conclusions connected with the qualitative picture of the nucleation process are presented.

entry.title: Inferring degree of nonextensivity for generalized entropies
entry.summary: The purpose of this note is to argue that degree of nonextensivity as given by Tsallis distribution obtained from maximum entropy principle has a different origin than nonextensivity inferred from pseudo-additive property of Tsallis entropy.

entry.title: Width of Rough Interfaces on Asymmetric Lattices
entry.summary: I present a calculation of the interfacial width within the capillary wave (Gaussian) approximation. The calculation is done on rectangular lattices of size L_1 times L_2, with periodic boundary conditions.

entry.title: Microscopic Deterministic Dynamics and Persistence Exponent
entry.summary: Numerically we solve the microscopic deterministic equations of motion with random initial states for the two-dimensional $\phi^4$ theory. Scaling behavior of the persistence probability at criticality is systematically investigated and the persistence exponent is estimated.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Mod. Phys. Lett. B

entry.title: An interpretation of Tsallis statistics based on polydispersity
entry.summary: It is argued that polydispersed systems like colloids provide a direct example where Tsallis' statistical distribution is useful for describing the heirarchical nature of the system based on particle size.

entry.title: The diffusion equation and the principle of minimum Fisher information
entry.summary: It is shown that the diffusion equation and its adjoint (time reversed) equation can be derived with only a few assumptions, using an information-theoretic approach based on the principle of minimum Fisher information

entry.title: Monte Carlo simulations and numerical solutions of short-time critical dynamics
entry.summary: Recent progress in numerical study of the short-time critical dynamics is briefly reviewed.

entry.title: New representations of the Hecke algebra and algebraic Bethe Ansatz for an integrable generalized spin ladder
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors, due an error in Bethe Ansatz equations (16).

entry.title: Exactly solvable model illustrating far-from-equilibrium predictions
entry.summary: We describe an exactly solvable model which illustrates the Fluctuation Theorem and other predictions for systems evolving far from equilibrium. Our model describes a particle dragged by a spring through a thermal environment. The rate at which the spring is pulled is arbitrary.

entry.title: Novel Coarsening in the Zero Temperature Dynamics of an Ising Chain with Kinetically Induced Field
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors.

entry.title: Skyrmions in spinor Bose-Einstein condensates
entry.summary: We show that spinor Bose-Einstein condensates not only have line-like vortex excitations, but in general also allow for point-like topological excitations, i.e., skyrmions. We discuss the static and dynamic properties of these skyrmions for spin-1/2 and ferromagnetic spin-1 Bose gases.

entry.title: Asymptotic Energy Decay in Inelastic Fluids
entry.summary: Replacement of cond-mat/0002383. Re-analysis of computer simulations, new figures and modification of conclusions.

entry.title: The "topological" charge for the finite XX quantum chain
entry.summary: It is shown that an operator (in general non-local) commutes with the Hamiltonian describing the finite XX quantum chain with certain non-diagonal boundary terms. In the infinite volume limit this operator gives the "topological" charge.

entry.title: Kuehn and Mazzeo Reply
entry.summary: We reply to a comment of Van Enter, Kuelske and Maes (cond-mat/0005176) on our letter "Critical Behavior of the Randomly Spin-Diluted 2-d Ising Model - A Grand Ensemble Approach", Phys. Rev. Lett. {\bf 73}, 2268-2271 (1994).

entry.title: Collapse of a randomly forced particle: a comment
entry.summary: We refute the arguments by Anton in cond-mat/0004390, which set out to disprove the existence of a collapse transition for a randomly forced inelastic particle.

entry.title: Stochastic Stability
entry.summary: In this talk I will introduce the principle of stochastic stability and discussing its consequences both at equilibrium and off-equilibrium.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings of the Conference Disordered and Complex Systems, London July 2000 7 pages and 3 figures

entry.title: Schulman Replies
entry.summary: This is a reply to a comment of Casati, Chirikov and Zhirov (PRL 85, 896 (2000)) on PRL 83, 5419 (1999). The suitability of the particlar two-time boundary value problem used in the earlier PRL is argued.

entry.title: Simplification of thermodynamic Bethe-ansatz equations
entry.summary: Thermodynamic Bethe ansatz equations for XXZ model at $|\Delta|\ge 1$ is simplified to an integral equation which has one unknown function. This equation is analytically continued to $|\Delta|<1$.

author.name: Minoru Takahashi
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for Solid State Physics, University of Tokyo, Japan

entry.title: Stochastic Aggregation of Point Particles Revisited
entry.summary: In the present letter we employ the method of the dynamical renormalisation group to compute the average mass distribution of aggregating point particles in 2 dimensions in the regime when the effects of local mass distribution fluctuations are essential
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, submitted to Phys. Letters A

entry.title: The thermodynamics of portfolios
entry.summary: We propose a new method of valuation of portfolios and their respective investing strategies. To this end we define a canonical ensemble of portfolios that allows to use the formalism thermodynamics.

entry.title: Exactly Solved Stochastic Directed Self-Organized Critical Models
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, since one of the key results duplicates existing work, as pointed out by a reader. I am currently revising the manuscript.

entry.title: Comment on ``Stripe Glasses: Self-Generated Randomness in a Uniformly Frustrated System''
entry.summary: comment on J. Schmalian and P. Wolynes, Phys. Rev. Lett. {\bf 85}, 836 (2000).
entry.arxiv:comment: 1 page, 1 Figure, accepted in Phys. Rev. Letters

entry.title: Comment on ``Specific heat of a Fermi system near ferromagnetic quantum phase transition'' by Grosu, Bodea, and Crisan (cond-mat/0101392)
entry.summary: We comment on various incorrect claims made in a recent paper by Grosu et al. (cond-mat/0101392).
entry.arxiv:comment: 1p., REVTeX; no Journal ref, electronic version only

entry.title: Do hard spheres have natural boundaries?
entry.summary: I use recent advances in the study of the susceptibility of the Ising model to propose a new mechanism for the freezing transition which is observed in three dimensional hard spheres.

entry.title: Profit Profiles in Correlated Markets
entry.summary: We consider a financial market where the asset price follows a fractional Brownian motion. We introduce a family of investment strategies, and quantify profit possibilities for both persistent and antipersistant markets.

entry.title: Order statistics for d-dimensional diffusion processes
entry.summary: We present results for the ordered sequence of first passage times of arrival of N random walkers at a boundary in Euclidean spaces of d dimensions.

entry.title: On the definition of physical temperature and pressure for nonextensive thermostatistics
entry.summary: It is shown that a recent proposal to give physically meaningful definitions of temperature and pressure within Tsallis formalism for non-extensive thermostatistics leads to expressions which coincide with those obtained by using the standard Boltzmann formalism of Statistical Mechanics.

entry.title: Linearity and Scaling of a Statistical Model for the Species Abundance Distribution
entry.summary: We derive a linear recursion relation for the species abundance distribution in a statistical model of ecology and demonstrate the existence of a scaling solution.

entry.title: Fluctuation Dissipation Relation for a Langevin Model with Multiplicative Noise
entry.summary: A random multiplicative process with additive noise is described by a Langevin equation. We show that the fluctuation-dissipation relation is satisfied in the Langevin model, if the noise strength is not so strong.

entry.title: Scaling in the Bombay Stock Exchange Index
entry.summary: In this paper we study BSE Index financial time series for fractal and multifractal behaviour. We show that Bombay stock Exchange (BSE)Index time series is mono-fractal and can be represented by a fractional Brownian motion.

entry.title: The Finite Energy Constant Magnetization of the Two - Dimensional Ising Model
entry.summary: We suggest the new definition of the magnetization. For the two - dimensional Ising model with the free boundary conditions we calculate any derivative of this magnetization for zero magnetic field.

entry.title: Comment on "Breakdown of the Internet under Intentional Attack"
entry.summary: We obtain the exact position of the percolation threshold in intentionally damaged scale-free networks.

author.name: S. N. Dorogovtsev
author.arxiv:affiliation: University of Porto and Ioffe Institute

author.name: J. F. F. Mendes
author.arxiv:affiliation: University of Porto and Ioffe Institute

entry.arxiv:comment: 1 page, to appear in Phys. Rev. Lett

entry.title: Dissipative maps at the chaos threshold: Numerical results for the single-site map
entry.summary: We numerically study, at the edge of chaos, the behaviour of the sibgle-site map $x_{t+1}=x_t-x_t/(x_t^2+\gamma^2)$, where $\gamma$ is the map parameter.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages with 4 figures, submitted to Physica A

entry.title: Generalized thermostatistics and Kolmogorov-Nagumo averages
entry.summary: We introduce a generalized thermostatistics based on Kolmogorov-Nagumo averages and appropriately selected information measures. The formalism includes Tsallis non-extensive thermostatistics, but also extensive thermostatistics based on Renyi entropy. The Curie-Weiss model is discussed as an example.

entry.title: Bornholdt's spin model of a market dynamics in high dimensions
entry.summary: We present results of an extension of the market model introduced by Bornholdt to high dimensions. Three and four dimensions are shown to behave similar to two, for suitable parameters.
entry.arxiv:comment: For Int. J. Mod. Phys. C 13, No. 1 (2002) with five figures

entry.title: Microscopic Models of Financial Markets
entry.summary: Submitted to F. Schweitzer (ed.), Microscopic Models for Economic Dynamics, Lecture notes in physics, Springer, Berlin-Heidelberg 2002.kiel.tex
entry.arxiv:comment: Abstract only of a long 2 Megabyte review

entry.title: The domino effect for markets
entry.summary: A generalization of the Cont-Bouchaud market model to three markets agrees with the correlations netween New York, Tokyo, and Frankfurt observed by Vandewalle et al.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages including 1 figure for Int. J. Mod. Phys. C 13, No. 2

entry.title: Reply to Comment on ``Absence of electron dephasing at zero temperature''
entry.summary: We explain why the objections raised by Golubev et al. in a comment on cond-mat/0111398 are not valid.
entry.arxiv:comment: 1 p., LaTeX, no figs; no journal ref, electronic version only

entry.title: Better be third then second in a search for a majority opinion
entry.summary: Monte Carlo simulations of a Sznajd model show that if a near-consensus is formed out of four initially equally widespread opinions, the one which at intermediate times is second in the number of adherents usually loses out against the third-placed opinion.

entry.title: Finite-sample frequency distributions originating from an equiprobability distribution
entry.summary: Given an equidistribution for probabilities p(i)=1/N, i=1..N. What is the expected corresponding rank ordered frequency distribution f(i), i=1..N, if an ensemble of M events is drawn?

entry.title: Gradient-limited surfaces
entry.summary: A simple scenario of the formation of geological landscapes is suggested and the respective lattice model is derived. Numerical analysis shows that the arising non-Gaussian surfaces are characterized by the scale-dependent Hurst exponent, which varies from 0.7 to 1, in agreement with experimental data.

entry.title: Superradiance from crystals of molecular nanomagnets
entry.summary: We show that crystals of molecular nanomagnets can exhibit giant magnetic relaxation due to the Dicke superradiance of electromagnetic waves. Rigorous treatment of the superradiance induced by a field pulse is presented.

entry.title: Energy Landscape and Isotropic Tensile Strength of n-Alkane Glasses
entry.summary: Submission has been withdrawn due to copyright issues.

entry.title: Advertising effects in Sznajd marketing model
entry.summary: The traditional Sznajd model, as well as its Ochrombel simplification for opinion spreading, are applied to marketing with the help of advertising. The larger the lattice is the smaller is the amount of advertising needed to convince the whole market
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages including 3 figs., for IJMPC 14, No.1

entry.title: The Magnetization by the Finite Energy Constant Magnetic Field in the Two - Dimentional Ising Model
entry.summary: We suggest the new definition of the magnetization. For the two - dimensional Ising model with the free boundary conditions we calculate this magnetization.

entry.title: Kolmogorov Scaling for the epsilon-entropy in a Forced Turbulence Simulation
entry.summary: We have shown that the epsilon-entropy determined from the time-series of the velocity fluctuation in a forced turbulence simulated by the lattice Boltzmann method obeys the Kolmogorov scaling.

entry.title: Aging in a Chaotic System
entry.summary: We demonstrate aging behavior in a simple non-linear system. Our model is a chaotic map which generates deterministically sub-diffusion. Asymptotic behaviors of the diffusion process are described using aging continuous time random walks, introduced previously to model diffusion in glasses.

entry.title: Spin Stiffness of Stacked Triangular Antiferromagnets
entry.summary: We study the spin stiffness of stacked triangular antiferromagnets using both heat bath and broad histogram Monte Carlo methods. Our results are consistent with a continuous transition belonging to the chiral universality class first proposed by Kawamura.

entry.title: Comment on Bramwell et al, "Universal Fluctuations in Correlated Systems"
entry.summary: This is a comment on "Universal Fluctuations in Correlated Systems", by Bramwell et al, Phys. Rev. Lett., 84, 3744 (2000.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Phys. Rev. Lett

entry.title: Wavelength Doulbing Bifurcations In A Reaction Diffusion System
entry.summary: In a two species reaction diffusion system,we show that it is possible to generate a set of wavelength doubling bifuractions leading to spatially chaotic state.The wavelength doubling bifurcations are preceded by a symmetry breaking transition which acts as a precursor.

entry.title: Computational strategies for mapping equilibrium phase diagrams
entry.summary: We survey the portfolio of computational strategies available for tackling the generic problems of phase behavior - free-energy-estimation and coexistence-curve mapping.
entry.arxiv:comment: 45 pages RevTex, 11 figures, Review article: Adv. Chem. Phys

entry.title: Theory of the Transient and Stationary Fluctuation Theorems for a Dragged Brownian Particle in a Fluid
entry.summary: Comment on ``Experimental Demonstration of Violations of the Second Law of Thermodynamics for Small Systems and Short Time Scales''

entry.title: Threshold value of three dimensional bootstrap percolation
entry.summary: The following article deals with the critical value p_c of the three-dimensional bootstrap percolation. We will check the behavior of p_c for different lengths of the lattice and additionally we will scale p_c in the limit of an infinite lattice.

entry.title: Comment on "Aging, phase ordering and conformal invariance"
entry.summary: This is a Comment on the Article ``Aging, phase ordering and conformal invariance'' by M.Henkel, M.Pleimling, C.Godr\`eche and J.M.Luck [Phys.Rev.Lett. 87, 265701 (2001)].
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to Physical Review Letters on 30 Jul 2002

entry.title: Simulation of reproductive risk and emergence of female reproductive cessation
entry.summary: Using a simple computer model for evolution, we show that in a sexual population subject only to age-increasing reproductive risk, a cessation of female reproduction emerges.

entry.title: Supercooled liquids, the glass transition, and computer simulations
entry.summary: Lecture notes for LES HOUCHES 2002 SUMMER SCHOOL - SESSION LXXVII on SLOW RELAXATIONS AND NONEQUILIBRIUM DYNAMICS IN CONDENSED MATTER; Les Houches: July 1-26, 2002

entry.title: Heat and Entropy in nonextensive thermodynamics
entry.summary: The concepts of quantity of heat and work are deduced in the non-extensive statistical mechanics context, following steps in parallel to those employed in the extensive statistical mechanics.

entry.title: Non-unique way to generalize the Boltzmann-Gibbs distribution
entry.summary: Alternative definitions are given of basic concepts of generalized thermostatistics. In particular, generalizations of Shannon's entropy, of the Boltzmann-Gibbs distribution, and of relative entropy are considered. Particular choices made in Tsallis' nonextensive thermostatistics are questioned.

entry.title: An Investigation of MBBA nematic within Generalized Maier-Saupe Theory
entry.summary: Generalized Maier-Saupe theory (GMST) within Tsallis thermostatistics (TT) has been used to investigate the second rank order parameter in a nematic liquid crystal, N-p-methoxybenzylidene p-n-butylaniline (MBBA). Also, the free energy has been investigated at the nematic-isotropic phase transition temperature and the effect of the nonextensivity has been demonstrated.

entry.title: Comment on Reply of Benedetto et al
entry.summary: We regret to point out several inaccurate and misleading statements that Benedetto {\em et al.} make in their Reply to our Comment on their paper titled ``Language Trees and Zipping''.

entry.title: Reply to the comment by I.Ispolatov and M.Karttunen, cond-mat/0303564
entry.summary: Reply to the recent comment by I.Ispolatov and M.Karttunen, cond-mat/0303564

entry.title: On the nonextensivity of the long range X-Y model
entry.summary: It will be given analytical and numerical evidence supporting that the X-Y model yields an extensive, i.e. proportional to the number of degrees of freedom N, internal energy U for any value of the interaction range.

entry.title: Fundamental thermal fluctuations in microspheres
entry.summary: We present theoretical analysis and the results of measurements of fundamental thermorefractive fluctuations in microspheres. Experimentally measured noise spectra are consistent with the theoretical model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 5 figures, extended version of report in Photonics West-2003, published in Proc. SPIE #4969-16

entry.title: Comment on ``Estimating $1/f^$ scaling exponent from short time series"
entry.summary: A recently proposed method (O. Miramontes, P. Rohani, Physica D 166 (2002) 147) for estimating the scaling exponent in very short time series may give wrong results, especially in case of undersampled data.

entry.title: Hydrodynamics of driven granular gases
entry.summary: Hydrodynamic equations for granular gases driven by the Fokker-Planck operator are derived. Transport coefficients appeared in Navier-Stokes order change from the values of a free cooling state to those of a steady state.

entry.title: Comment on the paper 'Thermodynamics of two-dimensional magneto nanoparticles' by P. Vargas, D. Altbir, M. Knobel and D. Laroze
entry.summary: It is shown that there is no bi-stability in the system of two-dimensional nanoparticles considered by P. Vargas et al.

entry.title: Tsallis entropy: How unique?
entry.summary: It is shown how, among a class of generalized entropies, the Tsallis entropy can uniquely be identified by the principles of thermodynamics, the concept of stability and the axiomatic foundation.

author.name: Sumiyoshi Abe
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Physics, University of Tsukuba, Ibaraki, Japan

entry.arxiv:comment: 21 pages. Contribution to a topical issue of Continuum Mechanics and Thermodynamics

entry.title: Analysis and modeling of science collaboration networks
entry.summary: We analyze a science collaboration network, i.e. a network whose nodes are scientists with edges connecting them for each paper published together. Furthermore we develop a model for the simulation of discontiguous small-world networks that shows good coherence with the empirical data.

entry.title: Nonextensive Thermostatistical Approach to the Thermoluminescence Decay
entry.summary: In this study, thermoluminescence decay is investigated within Tsallis thermostatistics (TT). We belive that this is the first attempt to handle themoluminescence decay process within TT.

entry.title: Reply on Comment of "Dynamic Behavior of Anisotropic Non-Equilibrium Lattice Gases
entry.summary: We reply the comment made by Caracciolo et al. (cond. mat./0305213) to our work "Dynamic behavior of anisotropic non-equilibrium driving lattice gases", cond-mat/021041.

entry.title: De Gustibus Disputandum
entry.summary: We propose a simple method to predict individuals' expectations about products using a knowledge network. As a complementary result, we show that the method is able, under certain conditions, to extract hidden information at neural level from a customers' choices database.

entry.title: Existence of the H theorem for the athermal lattice Boltzmann models with nonpolynomial equilibria
entry.summary: The entropy function is found for the two-dimensional seven-velocity lattice Boltzmann method on a triangular lattice. Some issues pertinent to the stability and accuracy of the seven velocity lattice Boltzmann method are discussed.

entry.title: Quantum Correction of Fluctuation Theorem
entry.summary: Quantum analogues of the transient fluctuation theorem(TFT) and steady-state fluctuation theorem(SSFT) are investigated for a harmonic oscillator linearly coupled with a harmonic reservoir. The probability distribution for the work done externally is derived and quantum correction for TFT and SSFT are calculated.

entry.title: Simulation of Galam's contrarian opinions
entry.summary: Galam's model of people voting always against the majority is shown to give for the quenched case different results than the original annealed model. For people diffusing on a lattice, Galam's phase transitions happen only at higher concentrations of people.

entry.title: Asymmetry in hierarchy model of Bonabeau et al
entry.summary: The 1995 model of Bonabeau et al. explains the emergence of social hierarchies through randomness, but gives as many leaders as followers. A simple modification allows a more realistic asymmetry with much less leaders.

entry.title: Reply to the Comment physics/0307134 by A. Helmstetter and D. Sornette
entry.summary: Reply to the Comment physics/0307134 by A. Helmstetter and D. Sornette

entry.title: Reply to "Comment on 'Universal Behavior of Load Distribution in Scale-Free Networks'"
entry.summary: Reply to "Comment on 'Universal Behavior of Load Distribution in Scale-Free Networks.'"

entry.title: Multifractal Analysis for the Dynamical Heterogeneity in Strongly Correlated Many-Body Systems
entry.summary: By calculating the non-equilibrium parameter of the probability distribution function and the singularity spectrum of multifractal we have quantified the dynamical heterogeneity in strongly correlated many-body systems.

entry.title: Introduction to Statistical Physics outside Physics
entry.summary: We review the possibilities and difficulties for statistical physicists if they apply their methods to biology, economics, or sociology.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages of opinions, no simulations, draft for Ladek Zdroj proceedings

entry.title: The Complexity of Biological Ageing
entry.summary: The present review deals with the computer simulation of biological ageing as well as its demographic consequences for industrialized societies.
entry.arxiv:comment: For Fractal 2004 proceedings, Vancouver; 12 pages of review including 6 figs

entry.title: Maximum entropy principle for Renyi's and Tsallis' entropies
entry.summary: The equilibrium distributions of probabilities providing maximality of Renyi and Tsallis entropies are rederived. New S-forms of them are found which are normalised with corresponding entropies in contrast to the usual Z-forms normalised with partition functions.

entry.title: q-Thermodynamics: First law for quasi-stationary states
entry.summary: We discuss peculiar aspects of the first law of thermodynamics for systems characterized by the presence of meta-equilibrium quasi-stationary states for which the pertinent phase/configuration spaces is generally inhomogeneous. As a consequence, the naive additivity requirement for thermodynamic quantities ceases to be satisfied.

entry.title: Lamb Mossbauer factor using non-extensive Statistics
entry.summary: Lamb Mossbauer factor is derived using Tsallis Statistics. Recoil free factor so obtained, has weak temperature dependence which is similar to the temperature dependence observed for Lamb Mossbauer factor of a fractal
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages,2 figues. Physics Letters A (in press)

entry.title: An equilibrium state with macroscopic correlations
entry.summary: In this paper we show that the equilibrium macroscopic entropy of a generic non reversible Kawasaki+Glauber dynamics is a non local functional of the density. This implies that equilibrium correlations extend to macroscopic distances.

entry.title: Qualms regarding "Non-extensive Hamilton systems follow Boltzmann's principle no Tsallis statistics--phase transitions, second law of Thermodynamics" by D.H.E. Gross, Physica A, 305 (2002) 99
entry.summary: A number of elementary misconceptions on the part of the author are corrected.

entry.title: Bounded confidence and Social networks
entry.summary: In the so-called bounded confidence model proposed by Deffuant et al, agents can influence each other's opinion provided that opinions are already sufficiently close enough. We here discuss the influence of possible social networks topologies on the dynamics of this model.
entry.arxiv:comment: proceedings COSIN meeting Roma, 9/2003 sub. Eur. J. Phys B

entry.title: The logistic equation and a linear stochastic resonance
entry.summary: We show analytically that a linear transmitter with correlated Gaussian white noises displays a stochastic resonance. We discuss the relation of this problem to a generalized noisy logistic equation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages and 3 EPS figures, submitted to Acta Phys. Pol. B

entry.title: Random Field Ising Model
entry.summary: Recent work on random field Ising model is described briefly emphasizing exact solutions of the model in simple cases and their relevance in understanding equilibrium and non-equilibrium properties of systems with quenched disorder.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at the DAE Solid State Physics Symposium, Gwalior, India, (Dec, 2003)

entry.title: Premium Calculation Based on Physical Principles
entry.summary: We consider the concept of equilibrium in economic systems from statistical mechanics viewpoint. A new method is suggested for computing the premium on this basis. The B\"{u}hlmann economic premium principle is derived as a special case of our method.

entry.title: Comment on: "Roughness of Interfacial Crack Fronts: Stress-Weighted Percolation in the Damage Zone"
entry.summary: This is a comment on J. Schmittbuhl, A. Hansen, and G. G. Batrouni, Phys. Rev. Lett. 90, 045505 (2003). They offer a reply, in turn.

entry.title: Reply to Comment on "Roughness of Interfacial Crack Fronts: Stress-Weighted Percolation in the Damage Zone"
entry.summary: This is the reply to a Comment by Alava and Zapperi (cond-mat/0401568) on Schmittbuhl, Hansen and Batrouni, PRL, 90, 045505 (2003).

entry.title: Non-Life Insurance Pricing: Multi Agents Model
entry.summary: We use the maximum entropy principle for pricing the non-life insurance and recover the B\"{u}hlmann results for the economic premium principle. The concept of economic equilibrium is revised in this respect.

entry.title: Calculation of Correlation Functions in Terms of Fluctuation Relation
entry.summary: We derive a relation similar to the fluctuation theorem for work done on a system obeying Langevin dynamics with thermal and colored noises. Then, we propose a method of calculating the correlation function of the colored noise by using this fluctuation relation.

entry.title: Features of incommensurate phases in crystals TlGaSe2 and TlInS2
entry.summary: The theory of a sequence of phase transitions of high-symmetry-incommensurate-commensurate phase controlled by competing order parameters is investigated. The temperature dependence of dielectric constant is derived. The comparison of the obtained results with experimental data for layered crystals is discussed.

entry.title: Classical and Quantum Fluctuation Theorems for Heat Exchange
entry.summary: The statistics of heat exchange between two classical or quantum finite systems initially prepared at different temperatures are shown to obey a fluctuation theorem.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 1 included figure, to appear in Phys Rev Lett

entry.title: Why the persistent power can be observed in mesoscopic quantum system
entry.summary: It is shown that one of consequences of basic principle of quantum mechanics at the mesoscopic level is violation of the second law of thermodynamics and that an experimental evidence of this violation was obtained long ago.

entry.title: On the maximum entropy principle in non-extensive thermostatistics
entry.summary: It is possible to derive the maximum entropy principle from thermodynamic stability requirements. Using as a starting point the equilibrium probability distribution, currently used in non-extensive thermostatistics, it turns out that the relevant entropy function is Renyi's alpha-entropy, and not Tsallis' entropy.

entry.title: Power-law tail distributions and nonergodicity
entry.summary: We establish an explicit correspondence between ergodicity breaking in a system described by power-law tail distributions and the divergence of the moments of these distributions.

entry.title: Fourier's law and maximum path information
entry.summary: By using a path information defined for the measure of the uncertainty of instable dynamics, a theoretical derivation of Fourier's law of heat conduction is given on the basis of maximum information method associated with the principle of least action.

entry.title: Langevin equation with Coulomb friction
entry.summary: We propose a Langevin model with Coulomb friction. Through the analysis of the corresponding Fokker-Planck equation, we have obtained the steady velocity distribution function under the influence of the external field.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 1 figure. to be published in Physica D

entry.title: Potts-like model for ghetto formation in multi-cultural societies
entry.summary: In a Potts-like model of $Q$ ethnic groups, we follow Schelling (1971) and Meyer-Ortmanns (2003) and simulate the formation of ethnic ghettos as well as their prevention by an increasing social temperature.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages including all figures, for Int.J.Mod.Phys.C 16, issue 3

entry.title: Various approximations for nucleation kinetics under smooth external conditions
entry.summary: Several simple approximations for the evolution during the nucleation period have been presented. All of them have been compared with precise numerical solution and the errors have been estimated. All relative errors are enough small.

entry.title: On the entanglement entropy for a XY spin chain
entry.summary: The entanglement entropy for the ground state of a XY spin chain is related to the corner transfer matrices of the triangular Ising model and expressed in closed form.

entry.title: A Note on Edwards' Hypothesis for Zero-Temperature Ising Dynamics
entry.summary: We give a simple criterion for checking the so called Edwards' hypothesis in certain zero-temperature, ferromagnetic spin-flip dynamics and use it to invalidate the hypothesis in various examples in dimension one and higher.

entry.title: Comments on "Stability of Tsallis entropy and instabilities of Renyi and normalized Tsallis entropies: A basis for q-exponential distributions"
entry.summary: It is shown that the Renyi entropy is as stable as the Tsallis entropy at least for Abe-Lesche counterexamples.

entry.title: Surface transitions of the semi-infinite Potts model I: the high bulk temperature regime
entry.summary: We propose a rigorous approach of Semi-Infinite lattice systems illustrated with the study of surface transitions of the semi-infinite Potts model.

entry.title: Noiseless limit of a ferrofluid ratchet
entry.summary: The noiseless limit of a thermal ratchet device using ferrofluids is studied in detail. Contrary to previous claims it is proved that no directed transport can occur in this model in the absence of fluctuations.

entry.title: A calculable and quasi-practical gas
entry.summary: A new kinetic approach is developed and a quasi-practical gas is defined to which the new approach can be applied. One of the advantages of this new approach over the standard one is direct calculability in terms of today's computational means.

entry.title: Boltzmann entropy and the microcanonical ensemble
entry.summary: Boltzmann's entropy is slightly modified to make it suitable for discussing phase transitions in finite systems. As an example it is shown that the pendulum undergoes a second order phase transition when passing from a vibrational to a rotating state.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, accepted for publication in Europhysics Letters, www.epletters.ch

entry.title: Five Years of Continuous-time Random Walks in Econophysics
entry.summary: This paper is a short review on the application of continuos-time random walks to Econophysics in the last five years.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages. Paper presented at WEHIA 2004, Kyoto, Japan

entry.title: On the Statistical Mechanics and Surface Tensions of Binary Mixtures
entry.summary: Within a lattice model describing a binary mixture with fixed concentrations of the species we discuss the relation-ship between the surface tension of the mixture and the concentrations.

entry.title: Critical Properties of Condensation of Field-Induced Triplet Quasiparticles
entry.summary: A review on the field-induced magnetic ordering is given, together with some results of a quantum Monte Carlo simulation focused on the critical behevior near the quantum critical point.

entry.title: Bose-Einstein condensation
entry.summary: The basic notions and the main historical facts on the Bose-Einstein condensation are surveyed.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Encyclopedia of Nonlinear Science, edited by A. Scott (Routledge, New York, 2005), p. 69-71

entry.title: Comments on paper by B.Lesche (Phys. Rev. E {\bf 70}, 017102 (2004)) "Renyi entropies and observables"
entry.summary: It is shown that Lesche's conclusions on instability of the Renyi entropy are the same for the Tsallis entropy, as well. Moreover, they are unjustified for both entropies.

entry.title: Critical Dynamics of Three-Dimensional Spin Systems with Long-Range Interactions
entry.summary: A field-theoretic description of critical behavior of Ising systems with long-range interactions is obtained in the two-loop approximation directly in the three-dimensional space. It is shown that long-range interactions affect the relaxation time of the system.

entry.title: Phase Transitions in Frustrated Vector Spin Systems: Numerical Studies
entry.summary: We present in this chapter a review on recent numerical studies dealing with frustrated vector spin systems in two and three dimensions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 52 pages, 14 figures, 163 references. Review to appear in "Frustrated Spin Systems", ed. H.T. Diep, World Scientific, 2005. Associated page: http://www.physik.fu-berlin.de/~loison/publications.html

entry.title: Voter model on Sierpinski fractals
entry.summary: We investigate the ordering of voter model on fractal lattices: Sierpinski Carpets and Sierpinski Gasket. We obtain a power law ordering, similar to the behavior of one-dimensional system, regardless of fractal ramification.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 5 EPS figures, 1 table, uses elsart.cls

entry.title: Comment on "Structure of a Quantized Vortex near the BCS-BEC Crossover in an Atomic Fermi Gas"
entry.summary: A comment on the letter by M. Machida and T. Koyama, Phys. Rev. Lett. {\bf 94}, 140401 (2005) and also on the preprint by Y. Kawaguchi and T. Ohmi, cond-mat/0411018.

entry.title: S-wave contact interaction problem: A simple description
entry.summary: The s-wave contact interaction problem has a very simple structure and a simple and straightforward description. This is not a standard paper, and technicalities are avoided. A bare and simple picture of the problem is presented, in the hope that it will be helpful to our theoretical study of the problem.

entry.title: Dependence of the superfluidity criterion on the resonance between one-particle (Bogoliubov) and two-particle series
entry.summary: We study how the superfluidity depends on the resonance between one- and two-particle series. The frequency of the spectrum of two-particle solutions in an interval is calculated.

entry.title: Reply to "Comment on equivalence between quantum phase transition phenomena in radiation-matter and magnetic systems"
entry.summary: A short Reply to the Comment of Brankov, Tonchev and Zagrebnov, quant-ph/0506207, is given.

entry.title: Fluid/solid transition in a hard-core system
entry.summary: We prove that a system of particles in the plane, interacting only with a certain hard-core constraint, undergoes a fluid/solid phase transition.

entry.title: Anomalous Scaling and Fractal Dimensions
entry.summary: The relation between critical exponents, characterizing a continuous phase transition, and the fractal structure of physical lines, proliferating at the critical point, is established by considering the two-dimensional O($N$) spin model for which many exact results are available.

entry.title: Note on cond-mat/0510119: Jarzynski equation for adiabatically stretched rotor
entry.summary: In a recent article (cond-mat/0510119) it has been argued that the Jarzynski equation is violated for adiabatic stretching processes of a three dimensional rotor system. Here we want to show that the reasoning is not correct. Rather, the Jarzynski equation is fulfilled for this adiabatically stretched rotor.

entry.title: Brownian Motion - Past and Present
entry.summary: We discuss Brownian Motion from a more elementary viewpoint presented by Einstein in 1908. Later developments and applications are briefly reviewed.

entry.title: A Solidification Phenomenon in Random Packings
entry.summary: We prove that uniformly random packings of copies of a certain simply-connected figure in the plane exhibit global connectedness at all sufficiently high densities, but not at low densities.

entry.title: Diffusion-Limited Annihilation and Coalescence in the Cayley Tree
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors, due to problems with the derivation of the main rate equation.

entry.title: Generalized Thermostatistics and Bose-Einstein Condensation
entry.summary: Analytical expressions for Bose-Einstein condensation of an ideal Bose gas analyzed within the strictures of non-extensive, generalized thermostatistics are here obtained.

entry.title: The q-deformed Bose gas: Integrability and thermodynamics
entry.summary: We investigate the exact solution of the q-deformed one-dimensional Bose gas to derive all integrals of motion and their corresponding eigenvalues. As an application, the thermodynamics is given and compared to an effective field theory at low temperatures.

entry.title: Most probable transition path in an overdamped system for a finite transition time
entry.summary: The most probable transition path in a one-dimensional overdamped system is rigorously proved to possess less than two turning points. The proof is valid for any potentials, transition times, initial and final transition points.

entry.title: Controversy about the applicability of Tsallis statistics to the HMF model
entry.summary: Comment to "Nonextensive Thermodynamics and Glassy Behaviour in Hamiltonian Systems" by A. Rapisarda and A. Pluchino, Europhysics News 36, 202 (2005).

entry.title: Random walks, Avalanches and branching processes
entry.summary: Bernoulli random walks, a simple avalanche model, and a special branching process are essesntially identical. The identity gives alternative insights into the properties of these basic model sytems.

entry.title: Entropy, Nonequilibrium, Chaos and Infinitesimals
entry.summary: A survey of the approach to Statistical Mechanics following Boltzmann's theory of ensembles and ergodic hypothesis leading to chaoticity as a unifying principle of equilibrium and nonequilibrium Statistical Mechanics.

entry.title: Entropy, Thermostats and Chaotic Hypothesis
entry.summary: The chaotic hypothesis is proposed as a basis for a general theory of nonequilibrium stationary states. Version 2: new comments added after presenting this talk at the Meeting mentioned in the Acknowledgement. One typo corrected.

entry.title: Boundary Dissipation in a Driven Hard Disk System
entry.summary: A simulation is performed aiming at checking the existence of a well defined stationary state for a two dimensional system of driven hard disks when energy dissipation takes place at the system boundaries and no bulk impurities are present

entry.title: Ways to solve of the evolution equation in the homogeneous free molecular condensation under dynamic conditions
entry.summary: The ways to construct solution of the evolution equation in the homogeneous free molecular condensation under dynamic conditions are presented in parametric form.

entry.title: Real symmetric random matrices and replicas
entry.summary: Various ensembles of random matrices with independent entries are analyzed by the replica formalism in the large-N limit. A result on the Laplacian random matrix with Wigner-rescaling is generalized to arbitrary probability distribution.

entry.title: General trends of the late period of evolution in the quasichemical model of nucleation
entry.summary: The periods after the end of the "primary" nucleation are considered. The approximate analytical description is given. The process is split into several periods which form the loop of evolution.

entry.title: Absorbing phase transition from a structured active particle phase
entry.summary: This submission to arXiv has been withdrawn by the authors
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn from the archive

entry.title: Extensivity and nonextensivity of two-parameter entropies
entry.summary: In this paper, we investigate two-parameter entropies and obtain some conditions for their extensivity. By using a generalized $(k,r)-product$, correlations for subsystems are related to the joint probabilities, so that the entropy remains extensive.

entry.title: Strength distribution of repeatedly broken chains
entry.summary: We determine the probability distribution of the breaking strength for chains of N links, which have been produced by repeatedly breaking a very long chain.

entry.title: Equilibration of two non-extensive subsystems in a parton cascade model
entry.summary: We study the process of equilibration between two non-extensive subsystems in the framework of a particular non-extensive Boltzmann equation. We have found that even subsystems with different non-extensive properties achieve a common equilibrium distribution.

entry.title: On the theory of supersolidity
entry.summary: We present a microscopic, many-body argument for supersolidity. We also illustrate the origin of rotons in a Bose system.
entry.arxiv:comment: references added; a prediction of supersolidity in Neon systems added

entry.title: Complexity of Self-similar Hierarchical Ensembles
entry.summary: Within the framework of generalized combinatorial approach, the complexity is determined for infinite set of self-similar hierarchical ensembles. This complexity is shown to increase with strengthening of the hierarchy coupling to the value, which decreases with growth of both scattering of this coupling and non-extensivity parameter.

entry.title: A heuristic approach to the weakly interacting Bose gas
entry.summary: Some thermodynamic properties of weakly interacting Bose systems are derived from dimensional and heuristic arguments and thermodynamic relations, without resorting to statistical mechanics.

entry.title: Asymmetry of the work probability distribution
entry.summary: We show, both analytically and numerically, that for a nonlinear system making a transition from one equilibrium state to another under the action of an external time dependent force, the work probability distribution is in general asymmetric.

entry.title: Geometrical Brownian Motion Driven by Color Noise
entry.summary: The evolution of prices on ideal market is given by geometrical Brownian motion, where Gaussian white noise describes fluctuations. We study the effect of correlations introduced by a color noise.

entry.title: Thermoelectric efficiency of heterogeneous media at low temperatures
entry.summary: A quantum limit of the thermoelectric efficiency for heterogeneous media with weak links is established with a use of the Landauer-type formulae.

entry.title: Condensate superfluidity and infrared structure: the Josephson relation
entry.summary: We derive the Josephson relation in a superfluid between the condensate density, the superfluid mass density, and the infrared structure of the single particle Green's function by means of diagrammatic perturbation theory. The derivation is valid for finite systems and two dimensions.

entry.title: Neel order in the two-dimensional S=1/2 Heisenberg Model
entry.summary: The existence of Neel order in the S=1/2 Heisenberg model on the square lattice at T=0 is shown using inequalities set up by Kennedy, Lieb and Shastry in combination with high precision Quantum Monte Carlo data.

entry.title: Comment on "Liquids on Topologically Nanopatterned Surfaces"
entry.summary: Comment on "Liquids on Topologically Nanopatterned Surfaces" by O. Gang et al, Phys. Rev. Lett. 95, 217801 (2005). See also an erratum published by O. Gang et al (Phys Rev Lett, to appear)

entry.title: Comment on ''Measurement of Effective Temperatures in an Aging Colloidal Glass''
entry.summary: We measure the fluctuations of the position of a silica bead trapped by an optical tweezers during the aging of a Laponite suspension. We find that the effective temperature is equal to the bath temperature.

entry.title: The non-equilibrium work relation. Thermodynamic analysis and microscopic foundations
entry.summary: We discuss the conditions for which the non-equilibrium work relation is valid by means of thermodynamic and microscopic arguments.

entry.title: Note on exponential families of distributions
entry.summary: We show that an arbitrary probability distribution can be represented in exponential form. In physical contexts, this implies that the equilibrium distribution of any classical or quantum dynamical system is expressible in grand canonical form.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. Phys. A: Math. Theor. 40 (2007) F691--F695

entry.title: Superstatistics: Theoretical concepts and physical applications
entry.summary: A review of the superstatistics concept is provided, including various recent applications to complex systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 28 pages, 9 figures. To appear in G. Radons et al.(eds): Anomalous Transport: Foundations and Applications (Wiley-VCH, 2007)

entry.title: Fluctuation theorem for black-body radiation
entry.summary: The fluctuation theorem is verified for black-body radiation, provided the bunching of photons is taken into account appropriately.

entry.title: Comment on: Failure of the work-Hamiltonian connection for free energy calculations
entry.summary: We argue that the apparent failure of the work-Hamiltonian connection for free energy calculations reported by Vilar and Rubi' (cond-mat arXiv:0704.0761v2) stems from their incorrect expression for the work.

entry.title: Some Insights in Superdiffusive Transport
entry.summary: In this paper we deal with high-order corrections for the Fractional Derivative approach to anomalous diffusion, in super-diffusive regime, which become relevand whenever one attempts to describe the behavior of particles close to normal diffusion.

entry.title: Lvy Statistics and Anomalous Transport: Lvy flights and Subdiffusion
entry.summary: Levy flights and subdiffusive processes and their properties are discussed. We derive the space- and time-fractional transport equations, and consider their solutions in external potentials. An extensive list of references is included.

entry.title: Effective interaction of exhausted regions in kinetics of nucleation
entry.summary: An effect of overlapping of exhausted regions around droplets of a new phase is analyzed. Several approximation to take overlapping into account are suggested. The small parameter responsible for convergence is extracted. The multi particle effects of overlapping are described.

entry.title: Exact thermodynamics of a planar array of Ginzburg-Landau chains with nn and nnn interactions
entry.summary: The exact expression of the free energy of a planar array of a Ginzburg-Landau chains with nn and nnn interaction is obtained. The critical behaviour of the specific heat is not qualitatively modified by taking into account the nnn interaction.

entry.title: Comment on: Inconsistency of the nonstandard definition of work
entry.summary: The objections raised by Vilar and Rubi [cond-mat arXiv:0707.3802v1] against the definition of the thermodynamical work appearing in Jarzynski's equality are shown to be misleading and inconsistent.

entry.title: The value of long-range interactions parameter for some alloys
entry.summary: The critical behavior of some alloys are analyzed within the framework of Heisenbergs model with long-range interaction. On based experimental values of the critical exponent $\gamma$ we calculate the value of paerameter of long-range interaction.

entry.title: Geometry and Topology in Hamiltonian Dynamics and Statistical Mechanics
entry.summary: This submission has been withdrawn by arXiv administrators because it is incomplete and thus violates arXiv policy.

entry.title: A cluster density matrix for the effective field theory with correlations
entry.summary: A cluster density matrix is introduced in the form suitable for the self-consistent calculation of relevant thermodynamic averages for the Ising model with spin S=1/2. On this basis, derivation of the Gibbs free-energy for the effective field theory of Honmura and Kaneyoshi is presented.

entry.title: Quantum Statistical Transition
entry.summary: By analyzing the BCS-BEC crossover, I found that because of the pairing interactions,a continuous family of quantum statistics interpolating between fermions and bosons is possible, although it seems incapable to construct reasonable wave function.

entry.title: Theoretical construction of 1D anyon models
entry.summary: One-dimensional anyon models are renewedly constructed by using path integral formalism. A statistical interaction term is introduced to realize the anyonic exchange statistics. The quantum mechanics formulation of statistical transmutation is presented.

entry.title: Non-Gaussian distributions under scrutiny
entry.summary: Comment of the very interesting paper by Hilhorst & Schehr, J. Stat. Mech. P06003 (2007). The main point is that one should be extremely careful when interpreting non-Gaussian data in terms of q-Gaussians.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Statistical Mechanics: Theory and Experiment 08 (2007) N08001

entry.title: Ratchet transport with subdiffusion
entry.summary: We introduce a model which incorporate the subdiffusive dynamics and the ratchet effect. Using a subordination ideology, we show that the resulting directed transport is sublinear, $<x(t)> \simeq Jt^{\beta}$, $\beta < 1$. The proposed model may be relevant to a phenomenon of saltatory microbiological motility.

entry.title: Using complex networks to model 2-D and 3-D soil porous architecture
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author to comply with the journal policy to which it has been submitted.

entry.title: Chiral Brownian rotor and heat pump
entry.summary: This paper provides some comprehensive calculations supporting the results in Phys. Rev. Lett. 100, 130601 (2008) [arXiv:0711.1758].

entry.title: A Field Guide to Recent Work on the Foundations of Statistical Mechanics
entry.summary: This is an extensive review of recent work on the foundations of statistical mechanics. Subject matters discussed include: interpretation of probability, typicality, recurrence, reversibility, ergodicity, mixing, coarse graining, past hypothesis, reductionism, phase average, thermodynamic limit, interventionism, entropy.

entry.title: Possibility of a new universality class: The anisotropic Heisenberg model with dipolar interactions
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to a possible inconsistency in the program code.

entry.title: Color-Swap models and other stochastic processes for nongrowing scale-free networks
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Wave Function and Pair Distribution Function of a Dilute Bose Gas
entry.summary: The wave function of a dilute hard sphere Bose gas at low temperatures is discussed, emphasizing the formation of pairs. The pair distribution function is calculated for two values of $\sqrt{\rho a^3}$.

entry.title: Conformal Field Theory and Statistical Mechanics
entry.summary: The lectures provide a pedagogical introduction to the methods of CFT as applied to two-dimensional critical behaviour.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lectures given at les Houches summer school on Exact Methods in Low-Dimensional Statistical Physics and Quantum Computing, July 2008

entry.title: Comment on: Failure of the Work-Hamiltonian Connection for Free-Energy Calculations [Phys Rev Lett 100, 020601 (2008), arXiv:0704.0761]
entry.summary: We comment on a Letter by Vilar and Rubi [arXiv:0704.0761].
entry.arxiv:comment: one page, including one figure; to appear in Phys Rev Lett

entry.title: The free energy of the non-isotropic Ising lattice with Brascamp-Kunz boundary conditions
entry.summary: The free energy of the finite and non-isotropic Ising lattice with Brascamp-Kunz boundary conditions is calculated exactly as a series in the absence of an external magnetic field.

entry.title: Comment on "Dynamic Scaling of Non-Euclidean Interfaces" [arXiv:0804.1898]
entry.summary: This is the revised version of a Comment on a paper by C. Escudero (Phys. Rev. Lett. 100, 116101, 2008; arXiv:0804.1898).

entry.title: Universal high-frequency transport in perfect photonic crystals
entry.summary: The light scattering in the periodic dielectric cylinder array is studied. We analytically calculate the diffusive-ballistic transport crossover and find the weak localization superimposing on it. Possible experimental observations are analyzed.

entry.title: Field theoretical representation of classical statistical mechanics. I. Wave-vector space
entry.summary: Thermodynamic equivalence between classical many-body system and some auxiliary nonlinear auxiliary field is proved. Connection between Hamiltonians of the many-body system and the auxiliary field is derived.

entry.title: Six out of equilibrium lectures
